headline: Marie's Easy Slow Cooker Pot Roast
description: This slow cooker pot roast is easy to make with a chuck roast, potatoes, carrots, celery, and onion soup mix for tender and juicy results every time.

video.description: Make a top-rated pot roast that’s quick and easy.
video.name: Marie's Easy Slow Cooker Pot Roast

name: Marie's Easy Slow Cooker Pot Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Season chuck roast with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat; add roast and sear to brown, about 4 minutes per side.
Place roast in the slow cooker and sprinkle soup mix on top. Add water, and scatter carrots, potatoes, onion, and celery on top.
Cover and cook on Low for 8 to 10 hours.

review.reviewBody: strange recipe1,put your finger in onion mix and taste ,do you want this in you roast? Brown the onions instead Do use broth, it is cheap and will make a huge difference. Wine is a good move,skip expensive burgundy ,this is not a Bourguinion, most dry dense wine will do (Hungary). do NOT SKIP searing and go way browner than the video shows, and wait 2 hours to start vegies .No I did nor try as said I can tell the bland result and mushy vegies.
Greetings. I used fearevilchickens' tips adjustments and it came out fantastically delicious! Thank you!

Ive made this recipe more times then I can count I love it and so does my family I just recommend adding your carrots celery and potatoes a little later so they don't turn to mush from sitting so long
Everything from the sear to the final presentation. Excellent
I made it with no potatoes in it. I made mashed on the side. Excellent flavor

Great recipe! I made sure to season my meat, wrap it up in Saran Wrap and then seat all sides before cooking. I cut my veggies in large cuts so they would not be mushie. Tasted before serving. I would rather have a recipe that’s lower in salt that I can add than a recipe with too much. This is an entire meal on a plate.
Super easy. Made it for my wife and myself. We didn't have the dry onion soup mix and substituted a can of Campbell's onion soup instead.

This is a wonderful crockpot recipe. I would add a little wine and seasonings of choice to taste. I’m fond of worchester sauce too. Adding vegetables later for more firmness is another option. That’s the beauty of a recipe like this.

I can tell you from experience. Do NOT add your veggies right away. They will come out mushy. Cook your roast for half the time recommended then add the vegetables. Also , check your roast for doneness before the recommended time . Eight hours is usually too long.
my second time cooking this. very yummy.
Added mushroom buttons to please my wife.
Simple but a little bland. Not bad though
Easy to make and super yummy

This is the best pot roast recipe I've ever had. After searing the roast in a large skillet, I removed it and added minced garlic and a tbls of sugar to the drippings in the skillet. Scraped up all the goodness on the bottom amd poured it over the roast in the slow cooker. Then I made a gravy with the liquid after the slow cooker had done it's thing. Fantastic recipe. One I will do over and over.

Made this a few times previously and thought it was about time to give a review. Simple but very flavorful. My only modification is to add a bit of Bell's seasoning (a mix of sage, thyme, marjoram, ginger, rosemary, oregano). But then use this blend frequently. Enjoy.

I have made this pot roast 4 times now. It is a really good meal! However, here are my thoughts/tips: Do NOT put your vegetables in the crockpot immediately. After 7-8 hours, they will turn to mush. Trust me on this. I keep my crockpot on the low setting for the entire cooking time, and I usually wait until I only have about 2-3 hours left of cooking time before adding the vegetables. Also, if you coat your pot roast with a little flour BEFORE searing it in the pan, you will have a much better flavored "crust" on the edges of the roast. (I found that tip about the flour coating on another website, and it really helps immensely with the flavor).

I made this Sunday and we enjoyed it immensely! BUT... I didn't have soup mix so I used brown gravy and added celery salt. I used a cup of red wine, because I'm a lush, and a little but of water. I also used turnips and rutabaga along with carrots and potatoes.
2nd time making it. 1change. Put cuts in the meat and put the garlic in the cuts.
Simple ingredients, great flavor!
Absolutely perfect!! Would not change anything!
Thank you! Delicious!!!
Awful mix between bland and slightly-off. For all the time this took, I wish I had found a recipe with more flavor.

This crock pot roast was fine, but did end up a little dry. It’s a good starting off recipe, but felt it could use more flavors. It was a good basic meal that my kids ate with rolls! But word of advice, expect to cook for a least 10 hours.
This recipe is so easy to follow. The meat came out so soft and juicy no knife needed just a fork.

I enjoyed making this! and it was really tasty. I had to improvise the ingredients because I did not realise I had no onions nor celery. But I did use the dry onion mix and I had celery seasoning and seeds. I also added about a tablespoon of A1 sauce. I even added a packet of the brown gravy mix. I also added a little parsley along with the thyme. Came out so tender and juicy. I put everything into the crock pot around 11pm and by 6:30am, my whole house was smelling heavenly! Now this picture is of packing some for lunch straight out the pot.
Taste amazing
Very simple. Very delicious!
I would cut this back to maybe 2.5 lbs of chuck and triple the carrots. I also added a whole onion diced up, a garlic glove finely chopped. Very flavorful
This was great. The only thing I did was add a clove of garlic and a tiny dash of cayenne pepper. Great.

This was a great recipe template.
You can really play around and be adventurous with this recipe.

I made it as written, with the only exception being I used 4 cups chicken broth instead of 1 cup water, and used salt and pepper before searing the meat, and after all ingredients were added to the pot. Came out great! Thank you for an excellent recipe!
Absolutely the best way to make Pot Roast. This is the 2nd time I've used this recipe and I swear each time has been better than the last. I will never use another recipe for my Pot Roasts.
This was easy and delicious. My only change was to add the vegetables halfway through the cooking time. I will probably use this as my 'standard' pot roast recipe going forward.
No changes….made it just like the recipe said. Very good…..my husband loved it
I have made this many times and it is one of my family's favorites.
Yeah, this is about perfect. I disagree with peeling potatoes, otherwise they fall apart. Other than that, this is pot roast perfection!!

Easy peasy. Quite yummy. I added beef bouillon to the water for even more flavor. It wasn't as tender as I had hoped it would be, but it was very tasty. My roast was 1.5 pounds, and I left it in the crock pot for about 7 hours. Maybe cook it for even longer? And I followed some others' advice and added potatoes, carrots, and onions about 1/2 way through.
I added 2 cups of sodium beef broth, and from that base, I was able to make a great vegetable beef soup!

It was great. However when I seared the roast in a pan I added onions and garlic and browned them in olive oil first. Then browned the meat. After I browned both sides I degreased the pan with a little wanter and added it to the roast. Also I added some beef stock to the water.
Fantastic!!
This is just something you need in your dinner rotation on those cold nights. Easy and flavorful. I added green beans to mine.
I’ve been making this recipe for years and it’s always great. I do make this recipe as the directions say to. It’s perfect for me to throw in the slow cooker before work. Very easy

I have made this twice in two weeks because the family requested it!
Made exactly as is and chose the beef broth option instead of water. Delicious!!!!!
Delicious and super easy!
I made this on a cold winter day and served it my family and friends. Everyone loved it. Next time I’d add a little red wine and use a mixture of water and beef stock. It was delicious.
Thank you finally a pot roast recipe without mushroom!thank you was absolutely delicious and house smelled so good. Omitted the celery as I didn’t have any.

Love this recipe!! A few changes I made was I seasoned meat with Montreal Steak Seasoning and a sprinkle of Worcestershire sauce before browning. But overall I love this recipe and so does my family! This is a keeper for my recipe file.

I liked this very much. It is basic and very easy. I scaled it down to 4 servings as I had a 2lb roast and used a whole packet of onion soup mix because I didn't want to waste the other half lol. I cooked the roast for 4 hours on low and then added the veggies and cooked another 4 hours to ensure I didn't end up with mushy veggies. Will be making again. GREAT BASE RESIPE!!

Delicious. My first pot roast! I threw in an extra onion and more carrots (5) plus a little more water and soup mix as my chuck roast was larger (by about 300 gr). Seems like a versatile recipe that can be adjusted to meet a variety of tastes. Will definitely make again..with even more carrots (as requested by the fam!).
Very good flavor. I cooked it a little too long and it was a little dry. Also, I added the veggies about 1/2 way through and they came out perfect!
Perfect. Jazzed it up with some of the suggestions by commenters but otherwise followed exactly. Thank you!
I followed the recipe but added 2 cubes of beef bouillon, 1 1/4 cups of water, and a can of beef consume for a little extra flavor. It came out delicious and my family loved it!
Very tasty recipe. I followed the recipe exactly. I also browned the roast in bacon grease. I had a 2 lb roast and it took about 7 hours on low to cook to fork tender.
Thoroughly enjoyed this recipe! The only thing I changed was that I substituted beef broth for the water. Thank you, Marie for sharing this!
Perfect just the way it is. My family loved it! A definite keeper.
great recipe. As suggested overnighted it in red wine vinegar and seared it before putting in slow clooker
Fantastic. Did half potatoes & half yams and used multi-color baby carrots. Beautiful & delicious
Recipe was good. I always follow the recipe on the first time. Afterwards I incorporate my personal tastes. This recipe was good overall. Next time I'll spice it up a bit.

I've made a lot of pot roast in my life, and this is hands-down my new go-to recipe! I seasoned with Montreal Steak seasoning, browned the meat for 3-4 minutes each side on high on the stove, and cooked it about 7 hours. Four hours into it, I added the carrots, potatoes, and onions. The veggies were perfect and not too mushy! I also added some Rosemary sprigs. This was gourmet!

Marie this was awesome. I haven’t made pot roast in so many years and this came out perfect! I’ve never seared my meat before, what a difference it made! I was a little leary about adding the celery since I never had. So delicious. Thank you thank you! My husband thought he’d died and gone to heaven.
This recipe was such a big hit for my family. I think it was the best roast i ever made. Roast was so tender and the veggies had so much flavor. I recomend if you try this don't change a thing.

The other reviews that state this is bland are accurate. I had to make the following edits the 2nd time around:

1. Add 2 normal size cans of cream of mushroom soup. 
2. Use beef broth instead of water
3. Add 3 cloves of chopper garlic. 

I cooked on high heat for 5 hours. It was good the 2nd time around. I also used starch to thicken then broth after it finished cooking because its very watery.

I used this recipe for my first ever pot roast that I made all by my liddle self LOL does not need much enhancement - delicious. I changed it up by browning meat in garlic and lotsa salt n peppa and other seasonings. I also added an extra potato, and 4 cut up parsnips with the carrots! AMAZING. Also threw some corn starch in the gravy to thicken. I will use this recipe as a base, because its fantastic.
I made and I don't cook. It was amazing and I was too.

Outstanding!

As I am on a sodium restricted diet, I used 1 teaspoon of sodium free beef bouillon granules and 3 tablespoons of dried chopped onions in lieu of the soup mix.

Also added some parsnips (as a tip of the hat to the pot roast of my youth).

Better than my memories of those dishes.

I love this recipe! I make it once every 3 weeks and it really delivers.

I made 2 changes- I use beef broth and I leave out the celery stock (I can't taste the difference).

As someone new to slow cooking and cooking in general this is a great beginner recipe!

Best wishes.

Thanks for all the ideas in the comments of how you tweaked this recipe. A lot of times I find a recipe that’s almost what I’m looking for and looking through the comments gives me ideas for how to turn it into something my family will love! I ended up adding the onions with the browned beef and the veggies halfway through. (My fam likes veggies cut small and I didn’t want to lose them in the sauce!). Yummy and easy

This time I had a 2lb roast. I used minced onion, 1tsp of Better than Broth base, 1c of water, and a can of low sodium beef both instead of the onion soup mix. Also, instead of regular salt, I used Garlic Salt to season with pepper before pan searing. The first time I had a smaller roast, followed the directions exactly, and had mushy onions. I’ll post in 8 hrs when this is done.
Wonderful and super easy! Added one can of Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup and used 1 cup Beef Broth instead of water. Kick it up a notch with 1/4 cup Dry Sherry.

I did not have a beef roast; so I literally used the cheapest pork loin roast you can buy instead, followed the recipe exactly to a T, making no changes whatsoever....the results....simply amazing. Pork Loin Roast fell apart like butter & was tender, juicy, and flavorful. A+++++, 5 Stars, Kudos to Marie. Less is truly More. Can't wait to try a beef roast next time, to review again. If I was a betting man I would say it's gonna be another 5 Star rating....
Good one thanks
It was tender and delicious
Great and easy todo .

This is now my go-to post roast recipe. Simple and delicious. Prepared according to the recipe, although I didn't have any carrots. Cooked for 10 hours and the roast was fall-apart tender and flavorful. Potatoes were perfect. I set aside some of the juices for later, and whisked flour into the remaining juices for a gravy to die for. (Be careful not to add too much flour!) Since leftover gravy (if you have any) thickens when refrigerated, I will use the set aside juices to thin it out when reheating. Great recipe. Highly recommend.
This recipe is amazing! My family loved it, meat was tender and juicy and the potatoes came out perfect!! Definitely gonna make this again!
My family said it was great. they enjoyed. Myself I won't eat it as I can't stand pot roast. But they seemed to rave about it.
Super easy and sooo good... I used Yams instead of potatoes
I made this tonight and I think it came out pretty good!

Loved this recipe and have used it countless times. Did not change anything the first time. Going forward, I now use red wine instead of water and will marinate overnite with olive oil & fajita seasoning.
was awsome and tasted great and the family loved it

OMG, this was delicious beyond compare. My wife and I made it as a joint project. I chopped all the ingredients in the morning before heading to work, and she took care of searing the roast and putting it all together in the crock pot.

That night, we had a most enjoyable meal! We both can't stop talking about how easy it was, or how wonderful a meal it made. The leftovers were just a delicious.
super delish. kids even loved it. add more veggies.

My family love it , came out great! I made limited changes I coated the roast in flour before browning , used beef broth instead of water and cooked it for 6 hours. I will definitely make this again .
Excellent taste & easy to prepare.
This is my go to for pot roast. I strain the liquids after cooking and then use it to make gravy.
I made this last night for dinner and it was melt in your mouth delicious!
This is a great start but I used beef stock instead of water, and added thyme, pepper, sherry and worcestshire sauce.
Delicious flavor! Next time, I'd make extra sauce for gravy. And the veggies only take half the time as the meat so I took them out and then back in at the end to warm them up.
Came out so tender and with a great flavor. Didn’t make any changes to the recipe.
This was just okay for me... to be honest it was a waste of money as we ate it because we had too
If tried a lot of different slow cooker pot roast recipes and this one was definitely the best!
Turned out great. Full flavor and made great leftovers.

Are the great reviews for this actual recipe or for the different recipes everyone created. It seems like everyone created a different recipe and just posted it under this recipe. Please people create your own recipe than post it so we can review it.
Good
Unfortunately, this had no flavor. Didn’t change anything. Made the recipe as written. So disappointed. Was really thinking it was going to be good.
No changes. 10 hrs on low. This came out fantastic. We'll definitely make it again.
Excellent easy recipe...

Really good, and super tender. If your meat is not quite all the way tender, keep going, it will actually get more tender with more time. I subbed some onion powder, garlic powder, and some other spices for the soup mix, and it still turned out great.

First pot roast I’ve ever made and I loved it! The only thing I would do different is add more water, I’ve always preferred my pot roasts to be more “soupy” (how it was made when I was younger). Would do again, very very good.

item.name: Marie's Easy Slow Cooker Pot Roast
